columns.name: LOG_SEQUENCE
columns.description: Unique sequence number for agent log records.

columns.name: AGENT_RUN_SEQUENCE
columns.description: A sequence number unique to the execution of a particular agent. A single execution will have at least two AGENT_LOG records and may have many more, depending on errors and LOG actions. This can be used to query corresponding records in AGENT_ACTION_LOG.

columns.name: PARENT_AGENT_RUN_SEQUENCE
columns.description: The execution sequence number of the agent that triggered the current agent to run. Null, if this is a top-level agent.

columns.name: STATE
columns.description: The agent state denoted by the log entry. Every agent will have a STARTED entry when execution begins, and a COMPLETED entry when the agent process is completed (i.e. all activity associated with agent completes). If an agent action raises an error, an ERROR entry is written. If a LOG action specifies writing a record to the agent log, a NOTE, WARNING or ERROR record will be written, depending on the LOG action specification.

columns.name: TIME
columns.description: UTC Time of the agent activity

columns.name: LOG_PROCESS_ID
columns.description: Log Process ID mapping the agent execution to the OTM log files. Note that this ID is only guaranteed unique within a 24 hour period.

columns.name: LIFETIME_EVENT
columns.description: The lifetime event (i.e. AGENT_EVENT_GID) that triggered the agent.

columns.name: AGENT_DATA_QUERY_TYPE_GID
columns.description: The data query type of the event that triggered the agent.

columns.name: AGENT_BUSINESS_OBJECT
columns.description: The business object PK of the object that triggered the agent.

columns.name: RUN_TIME
columns.description: For a COMPLETED record, the time (in seconds) the agent took to run to completion.

columns.name: NOTES
columns.description: For records output by a LOG action, user-specified notes to include in the log. Any agent variable macros specified in the LOG action will be evaluated before writing them to the log.

columns.name: ERROR_AGENT_ACTION_GID
columns.description: The agent action, if any, that triggered the Agent Error handler (typically via an exception).

columns.name: ERROR_CAUSE
columns.description: The cause of the error triggering the Agent Error handler.

columns.name: ERROR_OBJECT
columns.description: The business object PK that triggered the Agent Error handler. This may differ from the agent's business object if in a DTA or FOR loop.

columns.name: PARTITION_KEY
columns.description: AGENT_LOG must be partitioned for easy data management. A year's worth of data is stored, dropping the oldest week or quarter.
